body_html:
Thanks Guenther! We do have unit tests for this op in tf.contrib on the python side... were they disabled in the windows build?
…
On Tue, Jul 4, 2017 at 8:08 PM, Guenther Schmuelling < ***@***.***> wrote: It is dynamically loaded as dll here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/ tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_python.cmake#L879 but also statically linked here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/ tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L66 The fix is to add it to the exclusion list (like gru for example) https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/ tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L135 I can send a PR tomorrow (want to make sure the unit tests work for this since this might have never worked on windows) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#11277 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimwdpOWoGhhOJq8b21AYda2SbSoaPks5sKv4VgaJpZM4ONpFT> .
body_text:
Thanks Guenther!  We do have unit tests for this op in tf.contrib on the
python side... were they disabled in the windows build?
…
On Tue, Jul 4, 2017 at 8:08 PM, Guenther Schmuelling < ***@***.***> wrote:
 It is dynamically loaded as dll here:
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
 tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_python.cmake#L879
 but also statically linked here:
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
 tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L66

 The fix is to add it to the exclusion list (like gru for example)
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
 tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L135

 I can send a PR tomorrow (want to make sure the unit tests work for this
 since this might have never worked on windows)

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#11277 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimwdpOWoGhhOJq8b21AYda2SbSoaPks5sKv4VgaJpZM4ONpFT>
 .
body:
Thanks Guenther!  We do have unit tests for this op in tf.contrib on the
python side... were they disabled in the windows build?

On Tue, Jul 4, 2017 at 8:08 PM, Guenther Schmuelling <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> It is dynamically loaded as dll here:
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
> tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_python.cmake#L879
> but also statically linked here:
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
> tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L66
>
> The fix is to add it to the exclusion list (like gru for example)
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
> tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_core_kernels.cmake#L135
>
> I can send a PR tomorrow (want to make sure the unit tests work for this
> since this might have never worked on windows)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/11277#issuecomment-312985983>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimwdpOWoGhhOJq8b21AYda2SbSoaPks5sKv4VgaJpZM4ONpFT>
> .
>
